TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_A4_01
TestCase.Purpose: Positive test describing the eID-Client returning to the web-session.
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.
The eService has sent a default TC Token to the eID-Client.
The eID-Client has been activated and the communication channels TLS-1, TLS-1-2 and TLS-2 have been established.
The eService uses the certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_1] from [CERT_SET_1].
The eID-Server uses the certificate [CERT_TLS_EIDSERVER_1] from [CERT_SET_1].
The eID-Server has sent the CV certificate chain from [CERT_SET_1] in given order: [CERT_CV_TERM_1_A], [CERT_CV_DV_1_A].
The eID-Client and the eID-Server have successfully performed PAOS communication.

Command.Text: To finalize PAOS connection, the eID-Server sends the message "StartPAOSResponse".

TestStep.Description: The result code returned in "StartPAOSResponse" is /resultmajor#ok.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client starts establishment of a TLS session (i. e. performs a TLS handshake without HTTP interaction) to the server of the refresh URL to retrieve the server certificate of this server.
The URL used by the eID-Client matches the "RefreshAddress" element from the TC Token.

Command.Text: The eService accepts the connection TLS-1-2.

TestStep.Description: The eService uses TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_1] from [CERT_SET_1].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client directs the browser to the "RefreshAddress".

Command.Text: In case of a web server based Client-Interface, check whether the eID-Client returns "303 See Other" with the refresh URL.
Check whether the direction URL has an additional parameter "ResultMajor=ok".
